blocks.text: To return to the object of this paragraph â€” If $x_1, x_2, x_3, ", P_1 = \frac{1}{\sqrt{V}}$, $P_2 = \frac{1}{\sqrt{V'}}$ etc., and the probability that they all fall within this range $r$ is equivalently the product of these.

blocks.description: This equation represents the total probability of multiple independent events occurring, calculated as the product of their individual probabilities.

blocks.text: We wish to find for what value of $h$ P has its greatest value: Hence differentiate P with respect to $h$.

blocks.description: This equation shows the derivative of P with respect to h, indicating the relationship between various variables.
